title: The Block: Mitch and Mark recall the 'embarrassing' moment they ran out of money
text:
The Block's Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie blew their budget on Monday's episode.

And on Tuesday, the stylish grandads from Bondi Beach spoke about how and why they ran out of money.

During an interview with Triple M Sydney's Moonman in the Morning, they described the handling of their budget as 'hard to watch'.

'It's hard to watch': The Block's Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie (pictured) have recalled the 'embarrassing' moment they ran out of money

Mark explained they had under-estimated the price of several bills for their St Kilda renovation.

'We had a couple of bills that came in where we had an estimate on the price, but it came in and it was like, "Whoa, that was supposed to be eight grand and it came in at like 15,"' he said.

Radio host Lawrence Mooney then asked: 'Does anything in the building industry come under budget?'

'Well no, apparently not. Certainly not for me,' Mark replied, adding that he was 'gutted' to learn they had overspent.

Big mistake: Mark told Triple M Sydney on Tuesday, 'We had a couple of bills where we had an estimate on the price, but it came in and it was like, "Whoa, that was supposed to be eight grand and it came in at like 15"'

'It's hard to watch it as well because I felt really bad,' Mitch said.

Luckily for the couple, they were able to find a solution with the help of Scott Cam and The Block's sponsors, SunCorp, and got back on track.

'We found a way to get money together and we got back into the game,' Mitch added.

Embarrassed: Mark added, 'I felt embarrassed that I didn't have a handle on it, the way I thought I had a handle on it'

On Monday's episode of The Block, front-runners Mitch and Mark were shocked to discover they could not afford their bills.

Reflecting on how he'd screwed up the budget, Mark said: 'I felt embarrassed that I didn't have a handle on it, the way I thought I had a handle on it.'

The pair were forced to send home their tradesmen as they could not afford to pay them, leading to sneering from their jealous rivals, Tess and Luke.
